com.foreach.across.core.context.bootstrap

Class ModuleBootstrapConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.across.core.context.bootstrap.ModuleBootstrapConfig

  • public class ModuleBootstrapConfig
extends Object
    Represents the actual bootstrap configuration of an AcrossModule. This is the configuration that can be modified during the bootstrap process, without changing the initial AcrossModule configuration.

    Should be deprecated in the future, replace by AcrossModuleBootstrapConfiguration

    See Also:
    AcrossModuleBootstrapConfiguration

      • addExposeFilter

        public void addExposeFilter(BeanFilter... exposeFilters)
        Adds filters that will be used after module bootstrap to copy beans to the parent context. This adds the filters to the already configured expose filter.
        Parameters:
        exposeFilters - One or more filters that beans should match to be exposed to other modules.

      • exposeClass

        public void exposeClass(String... classNames)
        Expose beans matching any of the classes or annotations. If the class specified is not present on the classpath, it will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        classNames - to add

      • expose

        public void expose(Class<?>... classOrAnnotations)
        Expose beans matching any of the classes. If the class is an annotation, beans having the annotation will be matched, otherwise beans assignable to the target class will match.
        Parameters:
        classOrAnnotations - to match

      • expose

        public void expose(String... beanNames)
        Exposed all beans with the given names.
        Parameters:
        beanNames - that need to be exposed

      • extendModule

        public void extendModule(boolean deferred,
                         boolean optional,
                         Class... configurationClasses)
        Add a number of configurations that should be imported when bootstrapping this module. By default you usually want to import deferred configuration, in order to override bean definitions from the original module.
        Parameters:
        deferred - true if the configuration should be added after the initial module configuration and extensions
        optional - true if the configuration should not force the module ApplicationContext to be started
        configurationClasses - to import

      • extendModule

        public void extendModule(boolean deferred,
                         boolean optional,
                         String... configurationClasses)
        Add a number of configurations that should be imported when bootstrapping this module. By default you usually want to import deferred configuration, in order to override bean definitions from the original module.
        Parameters:
        deferred - true if the configuration should be added after the initial module configuration and extensions
        optional - true if the configuration should not force the module ApplicationContext to be started
        configurationClasses - to import

      • extendModule

        public void extendModule(ModuleConfigurationExtension... extensions)
        Add a number of configuration extensions that should be added when bootstrapping this module.
        Parameters:
        extensions - to add

      • exclude

        public void exclude(String... classNames)
        Explicitly exclude an annotated class from being added. If it has been configured previously, it will still be ignored.

        NOTE: this only applies to the application context, not the installer context.

        Parameters:
        classNames - to exclude

      • exclude

        public void exclude(Class<?>... annotatedClasses)
        Explicitly exclude an annotated class from being added. If it has been configured previously, it will still be ignored.

        NOTE: this only applies to the application context, not the installer context.

        Parameters:
        annotatedClasses - to exclude
